references.paper_title: Molecular contrastive learning of representations via graph neural networks
references.reason: This paper is the foundation for the current work, proposing a molecular contrastive learning method that is improved in this paper.

references.paper_title: Improving molecular contrastive learning via faulty negative mitigation and decomposed fragment contrast
references.reason: This paper directly addresses a key limitation of the original MolCLR method, improving upon it and informing the approach used in this work.

references.paper_title: MoleculeNet: a benchmark for molecular machine learning
references.reason: This paper provides the benchmark dataset used for evaluating the proposed method, showcasing its effectiveness on a widely-used standard.

references.paper_title: Pre-training molecular graph representation with 3D geometry
references.reason: This paper introduces the use of 3D geometry in molecular representation learning, a key aspect that is considered and built upon in this work.

references.paper_title: Equiformer: Equivariant graph attention transformer for 3D atomistic graphs
references.reason: This paper presents a novel model architecture that is employed in the experimental section of this work, allowing for comparison against a strong baseline.
